fees.waiverText: Annual fee waived on ₹10 Lakh annual spend

rewards.name: YES Rewardz Points
rewards.earningText: 18 RP per ₹200 offline (2.25%); 36 RP per ₹200 online (4.5%)
rewards.joiningBonus: 40,000 YES Rewardz Points (worth ₹10,000) on paying joining fee + ETPrime subscription worth ₹3,199
rewards.exclusions: Rental, Wallet, Fuel, Government, Marketing/Advertising, Post-purchase EMI, Instant EMI

calculator.specialLogic: Online spends capped at 100,000 RP/statement (~₹5.5L spend). 10 RP/₹200 on select categories (utilities, insurance, recharge). Redemption capped at 70% of cart value for flights/hotels.

redemption.bestOption: Flight/Hotel bookings via YES Rewardz portal at ₹0.25/point

lounge.domestic: 6 per quarter (Primary + Add-on). Requires ₹1 Lakh quarterly spend from April 2025
lounge.international: Unlimited for Primary + Add-on. 4 guest visits/year
lounge.accessType: Direct card swipe (no Priority Pass needed)

milestones.benefit: 40,000 RP + ETPrime subscription on joining fee payment

golf.text: 4 green fee waivers + 12 complimentary lessons (1/month) at select courses

movies.text: BOGO on BookMyShow, max ₹800/ticket, 3 free tickets/month

forex.text: 1% markup - One of the lowest in India

metadata.bestFor: High spenders seeking premium travel benefits with 4.5% returns on online spends and lowest forex markup
metadata.verdict: Best-in-class for online shopping rewards with 4.5% return, unlimited international lounge access, and 1% forex markup. Ideal for international travelers and heavy online spenders.
pros: Industry-leading 4.5% reward rate on online spends
Unlimited international lounge access for primary + add-on
40,000 RP welcome bonus covers joining fee
cons: ₹1 Lakh quarterly spend required for domestic lounge access from April 2025
Limited miles transfer partners (only Club Vistara & InterMiles)
70% redemption cap on flight/hotel bookings
Gift voucher redemption value devalued to ₹0.10-0.15/point

fees.waiverText: Joining fee waived on ₹40,000 spend in 30 days. Annual fee waived on ₹3 Lakh annual spend

rewards.name: YES Rewardz Points
rewards.earningText: 24 RP per ₹200 online (3%); 12 RP per ₹200 offline (1.5%); 6 RP per ₹200 select categories
rewards.exclusions: Rental, Wallet, Fuel, Government, Marketing/Advertising, Cash withdrawals, Post-purchase EMI

calculator.specialLogic: 36,000 RP cap per statement. Paid subscription plans available: 2X Plan (₹3,500/yr) or 3X Plan (₹5,000/yr) for accelerated rewards up to 6% on online. Redemption capped at 70% of cart value.

redemption.bestOption: Flight/Hotel bookings via YES Rewardz portal at ₹0.25/point

lounge.domestic: 3 per quarter. Requires ₹1 Lakh quarterly spend from April 2025

golf.text: 4 green fee waivers + 1 complimentary lesson per year

metadata.bestFor: Online shoppers seeking 3% returns with achievable fee waiver and low forex markup
metadata.verdict: Solid mid-premium card with 3% online rewards, achievable ₹3L fee waiver, and decent travel benefits. Subscription plans can boost rewards up to 6%.
pros: 3% reward rate on online spends (up to 6% with subscription)
Rewards on utilities, insurance, education (usually excluded)
cons: Poor redemption ratio (4:1) reduces effective value
₹1 Lakh quarterly spend required for lounge access from April 2025
No welcome bonus on joining
Limited international lounge access (6/year only)
Subscription plans add extra cost for best rewards

name: Yes Bank BYOC (Build Your Own Card)

fees.waiverText: Card fee: ₹249 Eco-friendly / ₹3,499 Metal (one-time). Monthly fee: ₹49+GST (Rewards) or ₹99+GST (Cashback). Optional subscription: Silver ₹99, Gold ₹149, Platinum ₹249/month for 10% merchant cashback

rewards.name: Cashback or YES Rewardz Points
rewards.earningText: Choose: 1% unlimited cashback OR 8 RP/₹200 (1%). Plus 10% cashback on selected merchants with subscription plans.
rewards.joiningBonus: ₹500 Amazon voucher on spending ₹1,000 within first 30 days
rewards.exclusions: Rental, Wallet, Utility, Fuel, Cash withdrawals, Post-purchase EMI, Instant EMI

calculator.specialLogic: Customizable card - choose Cashback or Rewards variant. Subscription plans (Silver/Gold/Platinum) offer 10% cashback on selected merchants (Swiggy, BookMyShow, PharmEasy, Uber, BigBasket) capped at ₹100/merchant/month. Utility rewards capped at 600 RP/statement.

redemption.bestOption: Cashback variant gives direct 1% cashback. Rewards variant: redeem for flights/vouchers

lounge.domestic: 1 per quarter. Requires ₹50,000 quarterly spend from April 2025

golf.text: 4 complimentary rounds/year + 1 lesson/month at select courses

movies.text: 10% cashback on BookMyShow via subscription plan (max ₹100/month)

metadata.bestFor: Users who want customizable benefits and targeted cashback on specific merchants like Swiggy, BookMyShow, BigBasket
metadata.verdict: Unique customizable card ideal for those who want to tailor benefits. Best for heavy users of Swiggy, BookMyShow, BigBasket, Uber, and PharmEasy who can maximize 10% merchant cashback.
pros: Fully customizable - choose rewards or cashback
10% cashback on popular merchants (Swiggy, BookMyShow, etc.)
cons: Monthly subscription fees add up (₹49-249/month)
Cashback on merchants capped at ₹100/merchant/month
Only 1 domestic lounge visit per quarter
No international lounge access
High forex markup at 3.5%
Cannot change core benefit (cashback/rewards) after issuance

fees.waiverText: Joining fee waived on ₹20,000 spend in 30 days. Annual fee waived on ₹2 Lakh annual spend

rewards.name: YES Rewardz Points
rewards.earningText: 12 RP per ₹200 online (1.5%); 6 RP per ₹200 offline (0.75%); 4 RP per ₹200 select categories
rewards.joiningBonus: None (but fee waiver available on ₹20K spend)
rewards.exclusions: Fuel, Cash withdrawals, Government, Marketing/Advertising, Post-purchase EMI, Instant EMI

calculator.specialLogic: 12,000 RP cap per statement cycle. Paid subscription plan (₹2,500/yr) boosts rewards to 5X on dining, travel, fashion, healthcare categories. Previously known as YES Premia.

redemption.bestOption: Flight/Hotel bookings via YES Rewardz portal

lounge.domestic: 2 per quarter (Primary only). Requires ₹50,000 quarterly spend from April 2025
lounge.international: 3 per year via Priority Pass (Primary only)

golf.text: 4 green fee waivers + 1 complimentary lesson/month at select courses

metadata.bestFor: Mid-tier users seeking balanced rewards, lounge access, and lifestyle benefits at affordable annual fee
metadata.verdict: Solid all-rounder card formerly known as YES Premia. Good for users seeking domestic + international lounge access, golf benefits, and movie discounts at just ₹999/year.
pros: Low annual fee of ₹999 with achievable waiver
Both domestic and international lounge access
Low 2.75% forex markup for its segment
Subscription plan available for higher rewards
cons: Modest 1.5% reward rate on online spends
12,000 RP cap per statement limits earning potential
₹50K quarterly spend required for domestic lounge from April 2025
International lounge limited to 3/year
₹100 redemption fee per request

fees.waiverText: Joining fee waived on ₹5,000 spend in 30 days. Annual fee waived on ₹50,000 annual spend

rewards.name: YES Rewardz Points
rewards.earningText: 8 RP per ₹200 online (1%); 4 RP per ₹200 offline (0.5%); 2 RP per ₹200 select categories
rewards.joiningBonus: None (but easy joining fee waiver on ₹5K spend)
rewards.exclusions: UPI (RuPay), Fuel, Rent, Cash withdrawals, Wallet, Government, Marketing/Advertising, Post-purchase EMI

calculator.specialLogic: 5,000 RP cap per statement cycle. Entry-level card previously known as YES Prosperity Rewards Plus. Subscription plans (₹1,000-2,000/yr) boost rewards to 3X-5X on dining, travel, fashion, healthcare. Available in RuPay and Visa variants.

utilities.label: 2 RP/₹200 on select categories (150 RP cap/cycle)

redemption.bestOption: Flight/Hotel bookings via YES Rewardz portal

metadata.bestFor: First-time credit card users or those building credit history with low income requirements
metadata.verdict: Basic entry-level card ideal for beginners. Easy fee waiver thresholds, decent 1% online rewards, and purchase protection. No lounge access or premium perks.
pros: Very low ₹499 annual fee with easy ₹50K waiver
Subscription plans available for higher rewards
cons: Low 1% reward rate on online spends
5,000 RP cap per statement severely limits earnings
No lounge access
No movie or golf benefits
₹100 redemption fee per request
No UPI rewards on RuPay variant
